method.name: GET
method.doc:
To retrieve the current list of available updates with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the available updates URI.
This API will return all known available updates, both from the online update server and any packages uploaded using the Upload an update package API.
This information can be refreshed by using the Check for available update packages or Check for uploaded update packages APIs.
Use the Install an update package API begin the installation process.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

representation.name: updatesJsonResponse
representation.doc: Note: Response body is an array.

param.name: state
param.doc: The current state of the update (For example, idle/running/installing/discovering)

param.name: schedule_date
param.doc: The date that this update is scheduled to be installed

param.name: iso_scheduled_date
param.doc: The date that this update is scheduled to be installed

param.name: release_date
param.doc: The date the update was released

param.name: version
param.doc: The version of the update. For "firmware" updates, this is the short version number such as "9.0.6.0". For "ipm" updates, this is a version number such as "3808.28174".

param.name: expired_install
param.doc: Whether or not the install will expire
